GridDatabase

A wrapper class for the PDO database library

Summary
GridDatabaseA wrapper class for the PDO database library
Functions
__constructThe constructor for new GridDatabase objects
connectEstablishes a connection to the database
queryPrepares and executes a SQL query
preparePrepares a SQL query
rowsExecutes a query and returns the results
rowExecutes a query and returns the first row from the results
valueExecutes a query and returns the first column from the first row of the results
assocExecutes a query and returns an associative array from the first and second columns from the results
columnExecutes a query and returns the first column from the results
escapeEscapes a string to defend against SQL injection
beginTransationDelays subsequent queries until executed with commit
commitCommits pending queries from the current transaction
rollBackCancels pending queries and ends the current transaction

Functions

__construct

public function __construct($config =  null)

The constructor for new GridDatabase objects

Arguments

$config(optional) Used to construct a PDO DSN for connecting to the database [array].  See connect for more details.

Returns

Nothing.

See also

connect

connect

public function connect($config)

Establishes a connection to the database

Arguments

$configUsed to construct a PDO DSN for connecting to the database.  The following database drivers and configuration options are supported:
  • mysql: host, username, password, dbname, unix_socket, port
  • sqlite: path, memory [boolean]
  • pgsql: host, user, password, dbname, port

Returns

Nothing.

query

public function query($sql,  
$vars =  null)

Prepares and executes a SQL query

Arguments

$sqlA SQL query to execute [string].
$vars(optional) Variables used for substitution in a prepared SQL statement [array].

Returns

A PDOStatement object resulting from the query.

prepare

public function prepare($sql)

Prepares a SQL query

Arguments

$sqlA SQL query to prepare [string].

Returns

A PDOStatement object prepared for the query.

rows

function rows($sql,  
$vars =  null,
$style =  PDO::FETCH_OBJ)

Executes a query and returns the results

Arguments

$sqlA SQL query to execute [string]
$vars(optional) Variables used for substitution in a prepared SQL statement [array].
$style(optional) Specifies how the results should be encoded.  See the documentation for PDOStatement_fetch for more details [integer].

Returns

An array of results (anonymous objects by default).

row

public function row($sql,  
$vars =  null,
$style =  PDO::FETCH_OBJ)

Executes a query and returns the first row from the results

Arguments

$sqlA SQL query to execute [string]
$vars(optional) Variables used for substitution in a prepared SQL statement [array].
$style(optional) Specifies how the results should be encoded.  See the documentation for PDOStatement_fetch for more details [integer].

Returns

A single row result from the query.  Encoded as an anonymous object by default, but varies according to the $style parameter.

value

public function value($sql,  
$vars =  null)

Executes a query and returns the first column from the first row of the results

Arguments

$sqlA SQL query to execute [string]
$vars(optional) Variables used for substitution in a prepared SQL statement [array].

Returns

A single value from the query [string].

assoc

public function assoc($sql,  
$vars =  null)

Executes a query and returns an associative array from the first and second columns from the results

Arguments

$sqlA SQL query to execute [string]
$vars(optional) Variables used for substitution in a prepared SQL statement [array].

Returns

An associative array of results from the query [array].

column

public function column($sql,  
$vars =  null)

Executes a query and returns the first column from the results

Arguments

$sqlA SQL query to execute [string]
$vars(optional) Variables used for substitution in a prepared SQL statement [array].

Returns

A column of results from the query [array].

escape

function escape($value)

Escapes a string to defend against SQL injection

Arguments

$valueA value or an array of values to escape [string or array].

Returns An escaped version of the string [string].

beginTransation

Delays subsequent queries until executed with commit

Arguments

None.

Returns

Nothing.

See also

commit, <rollback>

commit

function commit()

Commits pending queries from the current transaction

Arguments

None.

Returns

Nothing.

See also

<beginTransaction>, <rollback>

rollBack

function rollBack()

Cancels pending queries and ends the current transaction

Arguments

None.

Returns

Nothing.

See also

<beginTransaction>, commit
